item.title: Projmake-mode: Flymake Replacement
item.description: There is a great new Emacs plugin from Eric Merritt that like FlyMake builds your code and highlights within Emacs any errors or warnings, but unlike FlyMake builds across the whole project. You can clone the mode from here projmake-mode After cloning the repo to your desired location add this bit to your dot emacs file, replacing <PATH> with the path to where you cloned the repo. [gist]3794732[/gist] This Emacs code also uses add-hook to set projmake-mode to start for erlang-mode is loaded.

item.title: Getting Flymake and Rebar to Play Nice
item.description: TLDR; Copy and paste the following into your elisp erlang-mode configuration to get flymake working with Rebar projects. Intro Its probably no great surprise to anyone that I dislike Rebar a lot. That said there are times when I have no choice but to use it. This is always either because a company I am contracting for uses it, or an open source project I am contributing to uses it. When I am forced to use it there are a few things I don’t want to give up.
